div.head: Common Music Notation Ornaments
div.p: This module makes available symbols for indicating formulae of embellishment, or ornaments typical of Common Music Notation (CMN). These symbols have different resultions depending on a large number of factors such as time period, location, composer, scribe, etc. The ornamentation symbols here described, therefore, are not bound to a specific resolution; rather, they are meant to encode the typology of the symbol and its position on the staff.

Ornaments signify an addition of supplemnetary notes to one or more notes of the melody. Many ornaments are usually written above or belove a note; other ornaments have a more complex written expression, for example those that involve multiple notes and/or include grace notes to specify conluding turns or variations.
Based on this categorization, MEI offers two methods for encoding ornaments: one based on attributes and one based on elements. The following two section address both metods respectively.

div.head: Ornaments as Attributes
div.p: Many ornaments as usually written above or belove a note...

div.head: Ornaments as Elements
div.p: All ornaments in MEI can also be expressed as elements. Those ornaments with a more complex written expression (e.g. those that involve multiple notes and/or include grace notes to specify conluding turns or variations) are better expressed with elements.
